interpol module¶

Custom interpolations functions. Split the two major steps, finding grid mappings & interpoalting data, into 2 functions. Since grid is always the same, there’s no need to repeat this intensive set of steps.

interpol.interp_weights(xyz, uvw, d=3)¶

Calculate vertices and weights for grid. This function, along with interpolate(), splits up the functionality of scipy.interpolate.griddata.

Since the grid is always the same, there’s no reason to perform the same triangulation every single time, when only the values change.

SRC: https://stackoverflow.com/a/20930910/4465614

interpol.interpolate(values, vtx, wts, fill_value=nan)¶
